title: most peaceful place of mussoorie
review: This is an offbeat place so when in mussorie travellers you must visit this place without thinking for a second . This place is so peaceful you will listen the birds . The place offers the best view of dehradun and himalayas . The dog would accompany you to the place and wont leave you for a second . I just fell in love with the place and also the dog .. I would recommend strongly to all tourist to visit this place atleast for once ... There is no cost that you would be charged so keep a good camera as there are so many views which can not be missed once you visit this place ..

title: Good scenic place but not well maintained
review: It is lovely place have been visiting from school days 1977 when it was called Hathi paon no roads . With Uttarakhand tourism taking over the house is not well maintained. It is beautiful place during open sky day one can see most of Himalayan peaks

title: Serenity Unlimited
review: This is a place to visit if you like serene places. The view from this place is also excellent. Worth a visit.

title: Nice scenic bueaty
review: I visited George Everest mussoorie  on Sept month. It is a nice place to visit. There is an old house which was once upon a time occupied by George Everest. It is in a dilapidated condition. There is scenic bueaty but the road was horrible. It was taking also so one should not go there in rainy season.

title: Good place To visit
review: First you have walk Through a path for approx. 15-20 mins. here you will find some landscape where George Everest house was built. [ Not maintained at all by government] you can climb the mountain there slightly steep.

title: Good place to visit
review: Nice scenes from the house. There is also a small hike one can do to a nearby hill-top which can take 30 - 45 minutes to climb and give really amazing views all around.

title: Serenity and Tranquility to as far as you can see
review: One of the best places we happen to visit in Mussoorie was George Everest House, though post monsoon the last 02 kms are treacherous with broken road. It requires a real skilled driver to negotiate it especially when returning to your base in Mussoorie. Hire a sedan with a skilled driver willing to take you up all the way no less. Best part about this location is the Sunset in the evening, you may find lots of places in Mussoorie which give you miles expanses of nothing but nothing like the sunset here. No toilets/washroom at the location was disappointing. We spent close to 03 hrs at the location and thoroughly enriched our souls with nature's beauty. Will definitely visit it always whenever visiting Mussoorie.

title: Nice views
review: The house is ruined.

title: Crowded
review: The place was very crowded. Lots of veicles and people visiting. Plus the usual wall writings and stuff.

title: History ruined/beautified with graffiti.
review: The walk up is not great, I'll admit.

title: Muddy road
review: Actually the day we went there, weather was not good. It was raining and the road is also steep. It was muddy. When we reached there we could not get clear view of valley, due to clouds. Bad luck..

title: Amazing place
review: We visited this place just yesterday. Somehow the road is not that good to step on to the hill. But we managed to reach there. View from the top was amazing. We took many photos here. We spent almost 20 minutes here. We wish to spend more time here but the place was full of monkeys. So we step back and move forward for our next destination.

title: Pathetic state of an iconic structure
review: Never imagines the office/house of the person after whom Mt. Everest was named, would be in such a poor state. People have scribbled nonsense on the white walls of the structure and there is literally no due importance given to this place. The views from this area and around are stunning and possibly why Mr. Everest got this place made but the state of upkeep of this iconic place is worse than one can imagine.

title: Beauty to Explore
review: To visit this place one needs to go thorough patchy roads. But the view is awesome from the top. To reach peak one need to climb the mountain to reach. From the peak, one can carve out the map till Roorkee. There are a couple of joints to eat. One of the problem there is no washroom.

title: One of the best view of Mussoorie
review: It’s a good hike of about 2 km

title: Awesome place to trek
review: What a nice experience to trek to George Everest peak.The peak is about 0.5 km from Sir George Everest house. It takes about 20 -25 minutes the reach the summet and the route is easy.

title: Beautiful view of the hills and valleys
review: Trekking to this point is fun. The path is through the jungle that's full of greenery. The point offers a nice view of the hills and the valleys. Though one can go up there in a car, I would recommend trekking. In fact there are two routes to reach this point. The one via Wishing Well is much more serene as most vehicles take the other route.

title: Amazing
review: U can see the Himalayas from here spent some time and feel the natural beauty. and keep the place clean

title: George Everest mussoori..
review: This place is little tough..... But view from top is just amazing... I went there in December 2017 with my friends..... Time was morning 8-9 am..... Totally natural view and feel like just amazing....  If you love to explore more in Missouri so this place is right ... Must visit...

title: George Everset house
review: This is one of the beautiful place to visit. This is a place from where Mr George measured the height of Mount Everest . But the place is a mess now although its a beautiful place.When I last visited the place last year the place was full of garbage and thrash thrown by public. If you love tracking there is a hill where you can climb. There are just a couple of tea shops where you can get tea, Maggie and chips etc. So carry your own food stuff. The old building which use to be the observatory is just a haunted house and in very bad condition. The road from Mussoorie to George Everest is in very bad condition full of pot holes. But mid way there is a place full of lust green trees.

title: In Heaven
review: House of Sir George Everest was built in 1832. He was Surveyor - General of India. It was his Laboratory & House. From this point you can see panoramic view of Doon Valley and Snow Clad Himalayan Ranges

title: Mindblowing view
review: George Everest is located at a great altitude in Mussoorie and is one of the highest points. Nice tourist place.

title: It needs to be shown more respect by the visitors.
review: No graffiti please. It needs to be spruced up and a small entry fee charged to see it from inside. There's a fireplace, other well laid out rooms. Respect his work.

title: Good  view from top - very difficult drive to the place
review: Delipedated state of Everest's house was sad. Else, view was nice - good place to spend an hour or so.

title: "Must Visit place in Mussoorie"
review: Need to take diversion on the way to Mussoorie and some efforts of walking to reach at top, best to visit in early winters. little of messy road with Adventure

title: Picturesque  area
review: This place is around  one kilometers  from mussoorie  and have the tracking area,nice and picturesque  area

title: Just Amazing
review: Its amazing ... approx 1 km Tracking if you want to go Peak of the mountain .. food are limited only chips cold drinks Maggie eggs avl

title: Good Place for Sunny Day in Winter
review: Dating and lover's point

title: Spare your time :P
review: Hi Guys, this place isn't worth visiting via bike. But if you want to see how does mini trekking feel like, you can come here walking. When you reach the top, you won't find anything that can glue you to the place for more than 10-15 minutes.

title: Amazing view point
review: It's amazing view point of mussorie ...u can enjoy mountain view their ...its amazing view point for photo sation

title: Thrilling trek
review: George Everest is 5kms ahead from Mussoorie. You can reach George Everest house by two wheeler. To reach the peak of the George Everest you need to do a trek of about 1km. The trek is very steep and narrow and full of rocky path. The view of mountain, valley ,sunset and Himalayas is totally worth it. Himalayan range is easily visible from this peak.

title: excellent place
review: Very quiet place and best one to relax mostly at the tip of peak since very few people dare to climb since the path is very narrow and a bit slanting with nothing to hold on.

title: The best place to be
review: When you visit this place dont forget to go to the top of the nearby mountain and enjoy the thrilling short trek about 1 km up to the top most point. You will find breathtaking views from there and its also decorated with typical colored pieces of clothes.. That is the right place to be here else the Everest house is just an old destroyed property...

title: DECENT but not maintained
review: This is one of the oldest place of the Mussoorie to visit , this was been set up during British time and it's sir george who have fixed this for the research and other purposes

title: Geaorge Everest peak
review: Amazing view of doon valley from the peak, though we couldn't reach the top which was half a way more, still we could manage to reach from where we experienced panoramic view of the Doon valley.

title: Travel
review: One of the nice place , i loved the environment  , at reaching thousands of feet above the sea level this place makes feel pleasant , somehow it keeps me calm , the air quality  is at its purest level

title: One of my favourite place to chill out
review: This is my favorite place to visit whenever I get the off because this is the place where I can sit for a long time without getting bored . Here you can enjoy the view of dehradun and the kempty village. This is  one of the  highest  in musssoorie range.

title: Mezmerizing
review: I think this place is a bit hyped. A beautiful lace to trek or just go and have some good moments with your loved ones but when we are talking about Uttarakhand and specially about Mussoorie then i feel this place have been over emphasized. No doubt the view is mezmerizing and cold breeze will blow your mind. May be here i am bit skeptic because after been here in doon for almost an year and a half i have seen places which are far more beautiful than this  but not at all crowded. This place is crowded which i do not like.

title: Nice place!!!
review: The George Everest place was very nice and beautiful. The climate and weather was too good. Photography view was excellent.

title: George Everest
review: a calm and peacefull place far from the city crowd. must visit place in mussoorie. sunset view is amazing. you get to be a part of few adventure activities here too like zip lining. you can stay in tents also. people living here are very helpful and friendly.

title: Peaceful Scenic Place
review: Its a Beautiful place to visit. Immense scenic beauty on the way to this place. This place is about 40-50 mins away from the city and 2-3 kms patch just before this place is a little bad. Stayed in a camp at this place and it was indeed a very memorable and peaceful stay. Must try the maggie at a maggie point located at the top.

title: views to capture with your eyes
review: on this height, you have terrific views of mountains all around you, and it is never enough to capture all the moments in one view. i have visited this place many times, and each time feels new. best if you go with your motorbike.

title: Peacefull and amazing place
review: it is wonderful to visit this place. you can enjoy beauty of the nature peace and a hot Maggie with ur besties. we trekked till top of the hill.the crowd is awesome peaceful place to spend time.

title: natural beauty
review: it is worth to visit this place. a must visit place. it is far from city and road is not good. but when you will reach there you will feel cool

title: Ever tried Mountain biking !!!
review: This turned out to be one of the most tiring thing I ever tried . Mountain Biking from Mussoorie to George Everest . At steep height it was very difficult to push the bike up though there were occasional descending as well . But it's all worth the view and it was kind of a challenge which I completed . The greenery is eye catching while you tiredly pull the bike towards George Everest . People were watching us and sometimes praising it and laughing on us as well . There was a mixed feeling but we continued it and pushed our limits .

title: Not really worth it
review: We decided to walk here from Landour - it’s a quite long walk (around 9km each way) and the last part is on steep and uneven roads that people still attempt to drive up in cars and motorbikes which leads to traffic jams on tiny roads.

title: its an ancient building
review: its an ancient building offering good views of himalayas. only to visit if the weather is clear, nice views of the valley.

title: Much hyped place with zero maintenance
review: We found this site over web portals. It appears to be declared as tourist spot by Uttarakhand tourism. But accessible road is terrible, in fact there is no road. Thank god we were on fortuner, otherwise we could have been in trouble.

title: Amazing Trekk
review: We did trekking for George Everest and truly the view of Doon valley from George everest is mindblowing. Fresh air, peace & flora n funa was incredible.

title: amazing peaceful
review: it is far from city about 10 km but worth. if weather is good you will feel you are in heaven. dont go there in hot day or rainy day.

title: Wonderful valley view
review: Visit for wonderful valley view and heaven for trekkers. The road to reach there is in bad condition and can't reach the top. Park your vehicle it midway and walk. I got stuck twice.

title: Needs maintenance
review: This spot needs lot of maintenance as it is totally ignored by authorities.  it is a nice spot with lovely nature but not maintained at all.

title: Awesome Place For Camping And Enjoy Beauty of Nature
review: First of all i will start my journey from Dehradun to George Everest Peak, we had started our journey at 2.30 AM from Dehradun and went to this place for camping. During night the best place to watch stars light and enjoy beauty of nature.

title: The best view comes after the hardest climb!!
review: Well, the climb is not that hard at all. But the view from the top is definitely breathtaking. For all those photographers its a cherry on cake, with spectacular views all around.

title: Very beautiful walk from the main road
review: Despite having stayed in Dehradun all of my life,I hadn't visited this place before. Visited with a couple of friends,and realised what I'd been missing out on. The stretch from the main road to George Everest's House is extremely beautiful,with 2 small shops serving Chips,cold-drinks,Maggi.

title: Very Good Location .. !!!
review: It can be reached by car or bike from main road though the road is not very good . you can track also. view from the top is amazing. Though the house is in very bad shape. but nature is at her best. one can stay whole day on the top for picnic or camping if weather is good. I would defiantly this place while visiting Massoorie. and if you will stay little late evening you can see to sky. I mean Doon Valley with lighting and sky with stars. :)

title: Scenic beauty! Peaceful!
review: This place is about 30 to 45 minutes drive from Mussorie. The roads near this place are not very good... mainly kuccha roads as this place is a little untouched. Nobody is allowed to enter the house as it is sealed and maybe haunted! There is scenic beauty and a tea Maggi point. And also a resort on the hill.

title: amazing view
review: It is interesting to visit the house where George Everest, the first man who reached the Everest top, was spent some years of his life. Road is not good after strong rain. The view is amazing.

title: Nice spot with historical significance
review: The George Everest House is a good 40 minute drive away from town.

title: An Awesome 'but' Secluded Point
review: This place offer you a breathtaking view of Doon Valley. Its a different and nice place with 1-2 food joints, an abandoned house, and a small trek to the hilltop. The drawback is, for some people, the route. Its approx 5km. You would see a very few people on the way, mostly couples, so many pit holes on the road, actually its not 'sadak mein gaddhe', its "gaddhon mein sadak". However, the scenery on way is beautiful, so I liked the route. One suggestion, avoid going to this place when its about to get dark.

title: Amazing place to be
review: The approach to this place for the last 2-4 kms was pretty bad, not enough importance being given to this site it seems. Had a great experience though, thankfully it did not rain when we visited.

title: Den of hooligans and eve-teasers
review: I hiked to this spot one fine evening only to discover a lot of drug addicts, local goons, eve-teasers, hoodlums and people with all kinds of anti-social disposition having a gala time - heckling tourists, cat-calling, jeering at them, etc.

title: Remains in a very bad state
review: There is nothing much left of George Everest's house. It can be considered a good view point though if not worth visiting for the house or its remains.

title: good valley view nothing much, but on the way is good tall pine trees
review: its a hill top with where cab can go, road is not very good. A valley view is very good, but not well maintain. No shade or place to sit. But on the way view is very green and scenic.

title: Go for great veiws and historic reason
review: The house has been recently restored to be vandalized again by irresponsible tourists. However it has the best location and you get fabulous views of the Doon valley from the house. Also nearby is one of the platforms constructed for the great Indian Trigonomtrical survey. So the place has great historical significance.

title: Five star location with Zero maintenance by Himachal Tourism
review: It is tough to reach this place along poorly maintained road some 25 km outside Mussoorie city. The road branches off from the road to Cloud's end which is another tourist attraction. it is so sad that the house of Sir George Everest is not maintained at all by the Himachal Tourism. It is a shame because this man was so important to India as well as the whole world.

title: Offbeat place....nice little trek
review: A must visit place i should say, the views from here is good, the place itself needs some easy trek, though the car also can go there.

title: SAD - the young are spoiling this place
review: As excited u may be to really see some 18th century structure, but the road leading here is almost broken. Upon reaching, its a dejection that young of PB, Delhi, Dehradun take up to come here with LOUD BLASTING music playing HIPHOP, RAUNCY BOLLYWOOD ITEM NUMBERS... BEER BOTTLES IN THEIR HAND N THROWING TRASH AROUND.

title: Peak Point of Mussoorie
review: It is the highest Hill around Mussoorie, people can do trekking there and explore nearby Area, it has sunrise and sunset point as it is at maximum height, but the road is very bad, you need any SUV car or two wheeler to go there, otherwise definitely your car would need alignment after coming back from there. But the place is so so beautiful. Must visit there once

title: For the peace lovers
review: My fav spot in mussoorie, just sit on any hill and admire Mother Nature . Can also trek till the hill top .. the view is mesmerising..

title: Nature at its best.
review: For all those who has never ending love for mountains and enjoys tranquility, fresh air, company of good friends and strolling in peace then you do not want to avoid this place. This place is perfect to visit with your friends. 6 Km far from Gandhi Chowk/Library bazaar, this mountain is surrounded by beautiful doon valley on one side and Aglar River valley on other. Camping facilities is also available here. Camping, mountains, bonfire and friends, all you need to be happy.

title: Peaceful
review: I went on trekking with my friends till the top and the view that we got from the top was very relaxing and peaceful. We got to  know about the history of the place and I would really recommend people that if they love trekking then they must surely try this place.

title: Amazing views
review: Beautiful views of the valley from here. The drive a slightly tedious, but less than 30 minutes from the Mall. The outstanding scenery makes it worthwhile. A must do in Mussoorie!!

title: Need a demo on how to destroy a stunning place?
review: It is sad that this unique place with majestic views of the Doon valley and the snow capped peaks is frequented by urban dwellers who seem to be keen on: (a) play music and destroy the ambience (b) pollute the place in every possible manner (c) do everything other than enjoying the views. Hope this place could be revived and transformed into a magical sojourn for nature lovers!

title: Return Visit hoping it would be tidied Up!
review: I agree with the disappointment expressed by another recent reviewer re the mess that SOME visitors have left and continue to so do.  What kind or type of person would enter a park area and leave the remnants of their plastic orientated food strewn about the ground?  Why does the State Government which saw the merit of this historic area to create  " to develop of ..a state park " ... as the sign states, and then it would seem make no provision for some basic yet essential aspects of such a historic state park?  Fortunately the graffiti idiots have been prevented from entering the building though the outside which is presently littered with cow dung can still be a target.  A most unfortunate state of affairs to a very significant event in India, indeed of world importance. BTW .. you can drive up to the house via concrete road, though the back road is still accessible but involves a 10+ minute walk from stop and park. Suggestions are it will 'eventually ' be toll gated .Good!  Must mention the lava rocks visible in the area.

title: Beautiful View
review: Excellent view, can spend whole day sitting at this place. People plz stop writing on such beautiful spot's walls.

title: Paying tribute to Mr Everst
review: Decided to visit this place more out of appreciation of the great contribution of Mr George Everest. The house is in not-so-good shape, seems that some repairs / restoration work has been carried out recently but part of the house is still in very bad shape. The ride to the place is good, though part of the road is absolutely bad and the view of the valley from there is very nice. Would recommend to take a taxi, instead of own car. Visit can be combined with Cloud's End + wishing well.

title: George the Surveyor
review: George Everest was a cadet in Bengal artillery during the 1700-1800 era. He purchased the land from another britisher and built his home and office there to perform trigonometric survey etc. He is believed to have contributed towards the development of Mussoorie and calculation of some important survey datas related to Himalayan ranges. A one time visit is must as it is situated at a very high altitude and has 360 degrees scenic beauties.

title: Epic place
review: Visited with friends on a scooty along with a selfie stick to capture the scenic beauty of this place. Being fascinated by the historical monuments loved roaming inside the house and reading the texts n the walls.

title: ultimate hike
review: this place is at its best to enjoy the hill station. yes its littered but once you start climbing uphill its gets better.

title: Underhyped attraction
review: If i would have to select the best place to visit while at Mussoorie, it would be George Everest's house. The road towards the house is in a very bad condition and at a few turns we were not sure if we could even reach the place in our car. However, with driver's driving skill, we were able to make it. The house offers a good view of the valley and you have the option of trekking up to a point behind the house (~ a hour walk). The government could have done more to make this a well preserved and informative point of attraction, but little has been done in this direction.

title: On top of the World
review: Very beautiful place to visit. No entry fee. No vendors to disturb you. A fine trail for u to explore this place. Went there with my wife and cousins and had great adventure fun. Couldnt locate top point but the time spent there was awesome.

title: Heaven in between clouds
review: As soon as we got far away from the city,the roads got smaller but the views got better.so much green and when we arrived it was like omg,where am i.such a quiet and beautiful friends.had a wonderful time

title: Good
review: George Everest House (Park Estate) situated about 6 kms from Gandhi Chowk in Mussoorie and one of the major tourist place in mussorie

title: On Top of the Mountain
review: To know that the person who measured the tallest mountain in the world lived in Mussoorie came as a surprise. It is a pleasant walk off the main road. There is aan outfit or located here where one can have some exciting experience in mountaineering.

title: Can give a miss
review: First of all the road are very narrow and in bad condition. Also George Everest house is in bad state. Only saviour is the view or else nothing.

title: Fantaboulus
review: I have been to this place n number of times this place has got the 360 degrees view of Valleys.Apart from that this place is good for night out.We have have enjoyed this place like anything.We collected the woods from nearby & lit the bon fire.Overall it was different experience.

title: A good 4 hour trek
review: This place is good 4 hour trek point. On a clear day, the hill range view is very good from here. but on a foggy one, u can hardly see much. But a good place to trek to. Difficult to reach here with a tempo traveller. But a smaller car /bike is the best to get to this place. Usually crowed with a lot of young folk carrying bottle to booze over weekends.

title: A visit worthy of an uphill climb
review: We visited George Everest House in October 2016.  As the taxi we took was unable to go uphill through the rough road.  But the walk was quite worthy.  I needed around twenty minutes to reach George Everest House.  The house,  once resided by George Everest,  is presently a protected monument (though no work has yet been done to maintain the building).

title: amazing views
review: the views from this place is just amazing. the house itself is the main attraction. the area around is open and on a clear day the views are great. not much to do for kids. if you have small kids, can be skipped.

title: Good View and a dose of history!
review: This was the best part of my recent trip to the hills. We trekked from Hathipaon to George Everest House, and loved it. The house itself is in a dilapidated state, and the part of history lesson I learned here was unexpected. Apparently, Mt.Everest is named after George Everest who as a famous surveyor.

title: Serene Beauty
review: The beauty of this place can not be described in words. The place has a small trek and a 2 small huts for coffee and tea and maggi. This place is for people who will like to stay away from the hustle-bustle of the town.

title: Not-so-known but awsome
review: Its one of the lesse know place in mussorie. Thanks to our driver who suggested us this place. He told me when we locals think of going somewhere in Mussorie we think of this place.

title: A funny house atop the hills
review: No one would have known about this house unless there would be some sort of an activity to show you around. It's just a house and great sights from the heights there. You see snow covered peaks from the area and view are great. But overall nothing to do here, no food, no toilets and nothing touristy here.

title: Historical house going waste
review: This place has a great history. It was the residence of Sir George Everest (who was involved in the Great Trigonometrical Survey in India), in whose honour the tallest peak of the world has been named.

title: Mussoorie
review: Mussoorie is a beautiful hill station located in the lap of the Himalays .The air is crisp, the sky is crystal blue if it is not raining and scenery is enchanting.It is about 35 kms from Dehra Dun Railway station and 60 kms from Jolly Grant Airport. Taxis are available aplenty. One can make a days trip to and fro from Haridwar too but the best option would be to stay about two days and enjoy the serenity of the verdant hills. The town get extremely crowded on week-ends and there are severe traffic jams, so going on a week-end may be avoided.

title: Exquisite view !!
review: View from George point is very alluring . Reaching this place you have to bare Offroad conditions !! Approach road to this place is very pathetic , proper road is not there. Authorities have not taken care to develop this road. Otherwise very good place with a scenic views !

title: A Decade Later and what do I find
review: It has been a decade since I last visited this space and at that time 4 of us hiked over from the Charleroi Pleasant hotel.  Then as now,it makes for a great location for the 360* views.  However while the drawing card for us then was the George Everest House, it was disturbing to see that Nothing had been done in the interval to secure this specific landmark for History.  This man played a pivotal role in the mapping of India, to the north that great mountain bears his name, and hereabouts the terrain has gone to the cows, the litterbugs and those who seem to pay less attention to the earth they wlak upon.

title: Spectacular!
review: A rather tough ride in the car to get here but once you are there the views are spectacular.  It is such a shame that the authorities have neglected George Everest's house as it could and should really be maintained and maybe turned into a museum?

title: Amidst the clouds
review: Very near to Company garden in Mussoorie. Had gone there via car. Roads are terrible. Was scared that we may tumble down the hill. However... some pain n then we were there... George Everest's House ! House is in a very bad shape. 1-2 small stalls for tea and snacks. View was amazing.. simply breath taking.. clouds running over.. Its a beautiful feeling.. simply to be absorbed within you.

title: Nothing left
review: Well if you go to see the house there is nothing left but the views are amazing . Had maggi at a dhaba nearby and had enjoyed the view

title: Poorly maintained
review: Important - as this was the place from where height of mount Everest was measured, but it is the filthiest house I have seen, so be aware of that when you go there.

title: Lovely
review: Located right at the top of a hill , this place offers you a glimpse of 200 years old house of George Everest. The views are spectacular . The sad part .. all the lovers of the world got a chance to deface the monument .

title: Go early morning here dont miss herbal maggi
review: Do not go to this place after 09:00 hrs .. must reach here by 7am and leave by 9am else it gets very crowded .. you'll get to see whole mussorie from the hills.. it has this small dhaba which serves herbal veggi maggi with chai! must try that

title: Poorly maintained, not worth going
review: This destination in Mussoorie is just overhyped because of its natural beauty at the top of the hill but is completely worthless going since there is nothing over there. The road to Everest house is full of potholes and isn't safe. There is absolutely nothing to do over there.

title: The Best Palce
review: It is the most favourite place. Adventure, Trek, Thrill, Drive . . . all in one place. The view is always good here. Avoid trek during monsoons if you are fussy and faint hearted

title: Famous house of George.
review: Place is easily accessible by cab. Built in 1932 house shows shows some interesting facts about the life of this famous personality. At one side you can see awesome view of the verdant Aglar River valley & on other side snow-capped Himalayas.

title: The house
review: Dilapidated. Hopefully things will improve. After all the namesake of Mt everest is to live there.there is some talk of making it into a museum.

title: A dump with an amazing view
review: Awful, dirty place full of garbage! We were very disappointed and angry about the state of the place... even with the provided trashcans, the trash was EVERYWHERE, except the trashcans. The house itself is a ruin, with cow excrements and writing all over it, the same as the viewing point from where George Everest did the measurments.

title: Amazing views, nature at its best
review: The place is less known and not crowded. Best to visit during daytime as the route passes through forests. One can do a bit of trekking, or can just site and enjoy amazing views of Himalayas.

title: A piece of history in Ruins
review: Historical place .. home of G Everest . In ruins .. Located on a ridge Fabulous  view on both sides .

title: amazing place for party
review: I was on hill-top over the edge of the valley now. The clouds were creeping up slowly along the slope of the valley and engulfing us, caressing me with their coolness and softness more than a rose petal. I, with my open mouth, was trying to swallow clouds. I felt like I was lying over a white water lake with vast ghostly white clouds around me. I, even, couldn’t see more than two feet ahead of me. We were getting drifted into an endless channel of clouds. A glimpse of a hilltop cottage there seemed like a firm trekker standing there against all withering weathering throughout the day and night. When it used to get clear, wisps of clouds trailed the peaks as if the mountains were steaming.

title: Wish people had more respect for heritage
review: Could have been a gem in Mussorrie which doesnt have too many heritage sites other than religious ones. It has great views of the valley below and amazing vantage point of the doon valley below but the real tragedy is that visitors have shamelessly ruined the ruins!!

title: The best place in mussoorie..
review: This is the place that is in the category of must visit. It has got the best view in mussoorie. It is not that crowded.

title: Amazing place to relax
review: A place just to sit and relax. Have few joints there serving few snacks. To stay there need one own camp. Better to visit during day time with awesome weather and quietness.

title: George Everest Peak.
review: Didn't find the George Everest's house much attractive but the mountains backdrop and the landscapes are immensely pleasing. There are some food stalls near the house so you don't need to carry food and water.

title: Best place
review: Best place to visit in Mussorie . Very peaceful & cool place.must visit though it is better if u have your own car it is bit far.

title: best place for younster
review: best place to visit full on enjoyment no pollution only cloud and hills greenery full on masti best place for younster

title: Awesome place
review: Awesome place away from the hustling town of Mussorie...Trek of 2.5 kms takes you to the top of Everest Peak and one feel on the top of world. Must visit place.

title: Useless Place
review: I thought it would have some historical house or something interesting. But it is just an emty shell of an old house, badly maintained and there is nothing to see here just a waste of Taxi mones. Please AVOID it

title: Trek LalTibba to George Everest's house
review: Trek LalTibba to George Everest's house

title: Nice place for a good trek!
review: In the words of our cab driver...very nice place for youngsters - young adults!

title: One of the heaven on this earth
review: Come delhi,take an overnight bus to mussoorie and just withi 7 or 8 hour you will be in mussoorie, refresh yourself in a hotel, and without wasting any time trek to this mountain from gandhi chowk, and it,s just a trek of 7 k.m approx, you have two option to go here, which any localiet can tell you, one is from over the mountain and another one is from the main road, road which is going to camptifall, follow that road but in between way to george get separated, and after sometime you will be at one of the awesome place, there are 2 tea stall who provide maggi,omlet, pasta etc. I recommend you guys to go there only in summer season because view from george could be seen only when sky is clear . Have fun guys

title: Valley view
review: Good valley view.... In case you wish to c entire Dehradoon den would suggest landour... Good nice secluded place and so much better road.

title: Great Views
review: The place is great for people longing for silence and views. You can drive upto the basecamp, where the house is located, but the drive is tough with no roads and patches of up and down-hill. Though the real fun lies in trekking up to the mountain, which serves as the highest point in Mussorie. You can enjoy great views from the top of all around including Dehradun and Tehri. The base-camp has a small shop where you can have water, tea, coffee, maggi etc. The house itself lies in a secluded and lonely state and is not much to see there. The only reason behind it is the history of the great mountaineer that was George Everest.

title: Fantabulous View
review: The drive to reach to Everest House is beautiful and through the jungle and once on top the 360 degree view is breathtaking. The house is not in best of its shape but government is trying to restore the place and definitely  doing a good job though it can get better. The starting point on the road from Hatipoa is dirty and don't get disheartened by it coz as you pass through to the main jungle road it become beautiful and serene.

title: Not much of history!
review: When visiting the George Everest House, we were told that this place has historic value but we were disappointed to see that it was a house left to ruin with graffiti all over the place.

title: Away from main town with stunning view
review: This place is around half n hour away from Mussoorie, and is a common picnic spot for local youth. One side there is uninterrupted view of Dehradoon while another side close Himalayan range. This place is better known for Sir George Everest, who used to study about this mountain range from this place. But Government has failed to maintain the legacy of such an important person, after whom Everest has been named. This place, especially the building deserves something more than idiotic memories on wall like X WEDS Y and A LOVES B....

title: superb place
review: A place where all your depression is gone down the hills and the happiness and anxiety is up at the top. you will come again and again and fall in love with this place if you visit this place once.

title: Sir George Everest's House
review: Located at the Mall Road, this place has been home to the famous Welsh surveyor and geographer, Sir George Everest. He couldn’t stay untouched by the charm of Mussoorie and lived in here for some good thirty years. His house is now a famous tourist spot and is 6 km from Library Bazaar, easily accessible by cab. Built way back in the year 1832, this house showcases some interesting facts about the life of this famous personality. You can also treat yourself to some amazing views of the Dehradun valley on one side and the snow-capped Himalayas on the other from this point.

title: Place of beautiful landscapes
review: Almost 7 km from Library market. The house is in a very poor and ruin condition but the beauty around is admirable. It is the one of the most beautiful place of Musoorie full of beautiful landscapes and meadow. It is a place where you can spend lots of hours in capturing and enjoying the beautiful and calm nature. It is a must visitable place. A small tea stall is also available here where you can enjoy tea, prantha or snacks etc.

title: too far but beautiful and worth visiting
review: have to have a private vehicle to take you there, good place to see and visit with beautiful surrounding. House is very poorly maintained and only few remnants can be seen but view is awesome

title: Good place to walk
review: The house is just a shell. It was quite an anticlimax, actually :-( .... however, we walked down the road from the house to the valley and that was just divine! The pure fresh air, the scent of the forest and tall, tall trees all around made it a memorable couple of hours!

title: Majestic view, history comes alive
review: For all geography students & history buffs, it's a paradise, approx 10 KM from Library road. On one side the massive Mussoorie range profiles in blue lines and on the other side the plains Haryana, on a clear day you can spot the Yamuna from the higher observatory point.

title: Wonderful view but a challenge to get to
review: The view was wonderful. Money's abound as do many Tibetan flags.  There are 2 tea stall near by also on the hike up.  If you have extra time worth getting a car ride as close as you can and hiking the rest. The road is really filled with pot holes so difficult for car.  House is broken down- not worth the visit. But the view is really nice.

title: great views
review: stunned by the views.. less visited by travellers.. but i really loved the place.. picturesque..awesome

title: good views
review: i like this point for its views.. stunning.. u would love to spend a lot of time for sure.. less visited by travellers for its distant to mussoorie

title: top of the world
review: the point is a bit away from the mall and remember not to take up cloud end and george everest at the same time as they are in opposite directions and one will end up wasting time travelling.

title: Excellent view of the Himalayas
review: A short drive past our resort takes you far away from the hustle and bustle of Mussoorie to the magical views of the snow capped Himalayas. I almost envy George Everest for he got to spend a lots of years in this lovely home. I am glad that the local government is maintaining the property well. One could even take a short hike to a top of a small hill next to his house to get even better views of the Himalayas.

title: Peaceful place
review: The trek to the point was nice and the view from there was outstanding, serene.Not many people around to disturb you.
